profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by David Hill using EADitor ©2011

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Mostly correspondence written in German to Philipp Lederer, but also contains photographs of coins and other research materials.

daodesc.p: Part of a letter to Lederer from The Hebrew University, Jerusalem, 1939

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Philipp Lederer (1872-1944), was a numismatist who wrote works on the coins of Segesta and Nagidos, including Die Tetradrachmenpragung von Segesta (1910). He studied classical archaeology and ancient philology in Munich, earning a doctorate in 1910. Lederer fled the Nazis to Switzerland in 1939, living the last years of his life in Lugano.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The materials were donated to the ANS by Mark Salton of Hartsdale, N.Y., during the 1996/1997 year.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: No custodial history information on file for the period prior to 1996.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Philipp Lederer papers, 1939-1943, Archives, American Numismatic Society.

userestrict.head: Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright restrictions may apply. Permission to publish or reproduce must be secured from the American Numismatic Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Mostly correspondence written in German to Philipp Lederer (1872-1944), but also contains photographs of coins and other research materials.
